utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And reverse the spin on the antiproton, and gamma becomes alpha, multiplied by a matrix of negative I comma zero, and there we have it. Conclusive proof that I am absolutely worthless after nine o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Ghostly voice
utterance.content: Sheldon, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. All right, all right. I see what’s going on. A little pre-Halloween hijinkery. A ghostly moan, a rattling of chains, a witch’s cackle. The trifecta of haunted house clichés. Instead of eek, I say yawn.

utterance.speaker: Ghostly voice
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, the walls are dripping blood, which looks nothing like a phenolphthalein indicator exposed to a sodium carbonate solution. See you in hell Sheldon. The most frightening thing about that is the missing comma. Ah. Okay, all right. That one was clever. Skeleton with phosphorous on a zip line. Come on out, merry pranksters. Take a bow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You should’ve seen your face.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, there’s nothing quite like the slightly widened eyes of mildly startled.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, admit it. We got you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, fright depends on an element of surprise. The simple fact is, because I am much smarter than you, and able to anticipate your actions, it is highly unlikely that you two rubes could ever surprise me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s probably right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We can’t beat him. He’s just too smart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen. .

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who had money on faints?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I had pee his pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. Looks like everyone’s a winner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Watch out, Sheldon. This little boy Casper is a g-g-g-ghost!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Droll.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was pretty droll. With a hint of ammonia.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, enjoy your japes, gentlemen. You think you’ve poked fun at a milquetoast academic. Well, you’ve forgotten one thing. I am also a son of the Lone Star state. I’m Texas through and through. And we know how to settle scores down there. If you doubt me, ask Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hot girl, nine o’clock. Don’t everybody look at once!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is she doing in a comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t know, she might be lost. Doesn’t matter. Watch and learn. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Hot girl
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Um… it-it-it… Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Hot girl (to Leonard)
utterance.content: Are you getting this Next Men?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. It’s issue number 21. First appearance of Hellboy.

utterance.speaker: Hot girl
utterance.content: I know. I’ve been looking for it for years.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Hot girl
utterance.content: Hey, if I pretended to hit on you, could I distract you enough to sneak it away?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, but you’d be using your superpowers for evil.

utterance.speaker: Hot girl
utterance.content: Damn, I’m forbidden by my Kryptonian father to do so. I am Alice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: You are very cute, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks. You, too. You know, go ahead and take it.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: No, no. No, no, I, I, I did evil. Would you be open to a trade?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, yeah, sure, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Okay. Here. This is my number, call me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, palm’s a little sweaty. What’s that word?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Alice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, right, your name. That makes more sense than penis.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Later.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did we just see you pick up a girl in a comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: ‘Cause if you did, you get your picture up there on the Wall of Heroes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I don’t think I picked her up. Besides, I have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. This is the closest anyone’s ever come. You’re going on the wall, my friend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be sure to check the mail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How many times are you gonna tell me? What’s with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing. It’s not suspicious that I’m fixating. It’s consistent with my personality.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: More Halloween candy? Didn’t you just buy a bunch of it yesterday?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah. That’s gone. It’s a rough month when Halloween and PMS hit at the same time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard doesn’t have time to chat, he has to get the mail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you relax? I’ll get it in a minute. Hey, how was work?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Open the mail!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me. A couple of circulars, nothing important.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s with him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. You might be from Texas, but I’m from New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Check it out. Jim Lee drew this of me two years ago at Comic Con.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: What are you wearing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you know, it’s Comic Con. I’m Lion-O from ThunderCats.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Wow, you must have gotten so laid.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. But Jessica Alba did rub my furry belly.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Want to see a comic I draw?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. You have your own book?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s kinda based on my life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Cool. Oh, look. That’s you having sex with a guy in the top half of a Chewbacca costume. Comic Con?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: You’d think, but no.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re very talented. This is really good. Did you do…

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: So, can I trade you my comic for the Hellboy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can have my car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (creeps into office carrying a box)
utterance.content: Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear, oh, dear. Oh, dear, oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Purell, Purell, Purell, Purell.

utterance.speaker: Raj (entering)
utterance.content: Good morning, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is, isn’t it? Oh, bother. Isn’t that just always the way? You go to staple something, and you’re out of staples. Gosh, I wish I’d known that earlier today when I was at Staples.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You have a thing of paper clips right there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: well, no, no, I need something more permanent to join these papers. Say, don’t you keep staples in your top desk drawer?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be a lamb and check.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right. Who do we have here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a snake. A terrifying snake.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, did some bad man put us in a drawer?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stop talking like that. You’ve been rendered speechless by fear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s go to the biology lab and find you some nice yummy mice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I tried to scare an Indian with a snake. Come on, Cooper. You’re better than this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s open.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Want some mac and cheese?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Lactose. Gas.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Glass of wine?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Sulfites. Migraines.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’d offer you Halloween candy, but that’s gone. So, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, we used to go out, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, that’s where I know you from.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m dealing with a situation and it’s kind of about my love life, so I know that might be weird for us to talk about, but in this area, as you know, all my other friends are just so stupid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, you’re okay talking about this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re sure it’s not weird.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what, if you ever want to talk to me about a problem in your life with a guy, then I would be fine with that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, good, because there’s this one guy I used to date who’s about to be force-fed wine and cheese if he doesn’t get to the point.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh, here it is. Is it cheating if a guy has a girlfriend…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, probably.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I met this girl, and she’s great. We have a lot in common.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you guys do it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. We just made out a little.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, look at you, you bad boy. Did you tell her about Priya?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I was gonna, but there were too many tongues in my mouth.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s gross.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here’s the thing, I, I’m not one of those guys who sneaks around and sleeps with more than one woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The problem is, I want to be one of those guys.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So sleep with the new girl and lie to Priya.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s not who I am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, then break it off with the new girl.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now, let’s not do anything rash. She’s really hot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If you like this girl so much, why don’t you just end things with Priya?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Priya and I are in love. I think we could get married someday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, you’re looking for a way to sleep with both women and have everybody be happy about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now we’re getting somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What does your gut tell you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go ask Penny; she’ll know what to do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Howard. I’ve realized that you scaring me was all in jest. Allow me to say, job well done. Perfect.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Science. You wouldn’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, well, see you. I’m going out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought you were leaving the apartment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too. I can’t make up my mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you concerned because the world is filled with big dogs and bullies?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. I’m having a moral crisis.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if it’s of any help, I’ve read all the great moral philosophers, including Dr. Seuss.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, what the hell. I’m supposed to go see that girl from the comic book store, Alice, but I don’t know if I should, because I’m going out with Priya, but she’s in India.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. So the topic at hand is sexual fidelity. Probably won’t be relying on Seuss here. Although One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish might be surprisingly applicable. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, they say at the end of your life, you regret the stuff you didn’t do more than the stuff that you did, and I’m pretty sure Alice is the stuff I want to do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, the German philosopher, Friedrich Nietzsche, believed that morality is just a fiction used by the herd of inferior human beings to hold back the few superior men.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That actually does help.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s worth noting that he died of syphilis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Screw it, I’m going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On your way home, will you pick up some orange juice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you mind? I’m questioning a lot of things in my life right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is one of those things your fondness for orange juice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. Tropicana, no pulp.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s me, Sheldon, Mrs. Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not my mom, it’s Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? That’s very unsettling.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It just occurred to me that I never formally congratulated you on your pending nuptials. So I hopped on the first bus and hightailed it down here to shake your hand. Put ‘er there, you old so-and-so.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I, I’m gonna see you at work in 12 hours, don’t you think it could have waited until then?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Holy smoke, why didn’t I think of that? You’re a better man than I, Howard Wolowitz. You put ‘er there, you son of a gun!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whatever. My… oh… it’s…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, my God, Howard! What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was a harmless Halloween prank. Look.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard has a heart condition! You know that!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I thought he made that up. Isn’t hypochondria a common idiosyncrasy of Jewish people?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This is adrenaline, we’re gonna have to inject it into his heart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We are?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You are. I’m not strong enough to get it through his chest plate, and we’ve only got one shot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no! I can’t!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hurry! We’re running out of time!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Just do it!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, God! One, two, three!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Trick or treat, bubbeleh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? No. You mean this was all a ruse? Oh, how could I be so stu… .

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Damn it, I can’t. I can’t, I can’t do this.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Uh, is it my tongue stud? ‘Cause if that freaks you out, you’re in for a real surprise later on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no. I, I can’t do this. Believe me, I really want to.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: But?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But I kind of have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Are you kidding?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re cool with you and me just being friends, right?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: I don’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, I don’t, which part?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: I’m so stupid. I thought for once I’d met a good guy, but you’re just another jackass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, you have it wrong. No. I, I was going to be a jackass, but I stopped myself. I stayed a good guy, so, I’m gonna pass on the sex. But you should know, that’s not a comment on your hotness but on my goodness. That’s kind of my superpower. I’m, like, Captain Good Guy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s okay. Did the right thing. You idiot!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Priya.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hey, sweetheart. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, not so good. We have to talk.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, sounds serious. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh, here it is. I met this girl and I kissed her, and I feel terrible about it. But it’s done, it’s never gonna happen again. And I am so, so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard, relax. It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Yeah, these things happen. They happen to everybody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you are amazing. I mean, I don’t deserve you. Wh, what do, what do you mean everybody?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard, I didn’t know if I should tell you, but I kind of cheated on you, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, kind of?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: A couple of weeks ago, I slept with my ex-boyfriend. So, I guess we both messed up a little.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, I messed up a little. You messed up a lot.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Well, it’s not a competition.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it is, and you won. I, I, I’m, I’m sorry, I have to go. I don’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (leaping out of the base of the sofa)
utterance.content: Bazinga, punk. Now we’re even.
